title: ICE: Trying to compare incompatible constructors

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Unfortunately it is a closed project and I have not been able to determine a minimal example, thus I am unable to provide any code -- Sorry. ### Meta The error occurs only when using the Docker image `rustlang/rust:nightly`. I am able to compile the code on my development machine, using the `rustc` version `rustc --version --verbose`: *(Working version)* ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (ffa2e7ae8 2020-10-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: ffa2e7ae8fbf9badc035740db949b9dae271c29f commit-date: 2020-10-24 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.49.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0 ``` `rustc --version --verbose`: *(version spawning the ICE)* ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (ffe52882e 2020-10-30) binary: rustc commit-hash: ffe52882ed79be67344dd6085559e308241e7f60 commit-date: 2020-10-30 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.49.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/thir/pattern/_match.rs:931:18: trying to compare incompatible constructors Single and Str(Const { ty: &str, val: Value(Slice { data: Allocation { bytes: [105, 115, 115, 117, 101], relocations: Relocations(SortedMap { data: [] }), init_mask: InitMask { blocks: [31], len: Size { raw: 5 } }, size: Size { raw: 5 }, align: Align { pow2: 0 }, mutability: Not, extra: () }, start: 0, end: 5 }) }) ```
Backtrace
